snippet: “Sumeida’s Song,” the first opera by the young Arab-American composer Mohammed Fairouz, is a four-character opera based on the play “Song of Death” by the prominent Egyptian writer Tawfiq al-Hakim.
abstract: Anthony Tommasini reviews Here Arts Center and Beth Morrison Projects production of Mohammed Fairouz opera Sumeida's Song, part of Prototype festival of musical theater.
lead_paragraph: “Sumeida’s Song,” the first opera by the young Arab-American composer Mohammed Fairouz, is a four-character opera based on the play “Song of Death” by the prominent Egyptian writer Tawfiq al-Hakim.

headline.main: No Exit for Returning Son Who Upsets His Family’s Expectation of Vengeance
headline.print_headline: No Exit for Returning Son Who Upsets His Family’s Expectation of Vengeance
